original: @332b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @332b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: shr'i ba su dha r'a s'a dha nam /
analyzed: shr'i ba su dha r'a s'a dha nam /
translated: Śrīvasudhārā-sādhana

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: dpal nor rgyun ma'i sgrub thabs /
analyzed: dpal nor rgyun ma'i sgrub thabs /
translated: The Sādhana of Glorious Vasudhārā

original: dkon mchog gsum la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Three Jewels!

original: phyogs bcu kun na bzhugs pa yi //
analyzed: phyogs bcu kun na bzhugs pa yi //
translated: All the buddhas dwelling in the ten directions,

original: sangs rgyas bdag la dgongs su gsol //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bdag la dgongs su gsol //
translated: Please consider me!

original: dbul ba kun las sgrol mdzad cing //
analyzed: dbul ba kun las sgrol mdzad cing //
translated: You who liberate from all poverty

original: chos min sel bar mdzad pa mo //
analyzed: chos min sel bar mdzad pa mo //
translated: And clear away what is not the Dharma,

original: phun tshogs yang dag stsol mdzad ma //
analyzed: phun tshogs yang dag stsol mdzad ma //
translated: You who grant perfect abundance,

original: nor rgyun ma la rtag phyag 'tshal //
analyzed: nor rgyun ma la rtag phyag 'tshal //
translated: I constantly pay homage to Vasudhārā.

original: sbyin bya dang sbyin pa po ste gsum po mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du dag pa chos rnams thams cad rang bzhin gyis dag pa nga nyid do //
analyzed: sbyin bya dang sbyin pa po ste gsum po mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du dag pa chos rnams thams cad rang bzhin gyis dag pa nga nyid do //
translated: The purity of the three—the object given, the giver, and the recipient—in the nature of emptiness, the non-apprehension of the three, is me, the natural purity of all phenomena.

original: stong nyid ye shes rdo rje'i rang bzhin nga'o //
analyzed: stong nyid ye shes rdo rje'i rang bzhin nga'o //
translated: I am the nature of the vajra of the wisdom of emptiness.

original: de las langs nas rang gi snying khar pam yig gis padma dang de'i steng du aa yig gis zla ba'i dkyil 'khor te /
analyzed: de las langs nas rang gi snying khar pam yig gis padma dang de'i steng du aa yig gis zla ba'i dkyil 'khor te /
translated: Arising from that, in my heart is a paṃ syllable, from which arises a lotus, and upon that, an a syllable from which arises a moon maṇḍala.

original: de'i steng du tslum gi yi ges bdag nyid bcom ldan 'das ma nor rgyun mar bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i steng du tslum gi yi ges bdag nyid bcom ldan 'das ma nor rgyun mar bsgom par bya ste /
translated: On top of that, one should visualize oneself as the Blessed Lady Vasudharā with the syllable “c” .

original: phyag gnyis ma rin po che'i cod pan can /
analyzed: phyag gnyis ma rin po che'i cod pan can /
translated: She has two arms and a jeweled crown.

original: sku mdog ser mo zhal gcig ma //
analyzed: sku mdog ser mo zhal gcig ma //
translated: Her body is yellow, with one face.

original: rol pa'i stabs kyis bzhugs pa //
analyzed: rol pa'i stabs kyis bzhugs pa //
translated: She stands in a dancing posture.

original: phyag mchog sbyin dang / bum pa bzang po can no //
analyzed: phyag mchog sbyin dang / bum pa bzang po can no //
translated: Her hands are in the boon-granting and excellent vase gestures.

original: aom shr'i ba su dha ro& ham /🔽aa yig gis zla ba'i dkyil 'khor te /
analyzed: aom shr'i ba su dha ro& ham / aa yig gis zla ba'i dkyil 'khor te /
translated: “Oṃ, Śrī Vasudharā, I am!🔽The syllable “a” is the moon maṇḍala.

original: a'a yig gis nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: a'a yig gis nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The syllable “ā” is the sun maṇḍala.

original: aom badzra padma ha stvam ham /
analyzed: aom badzra padma ha stvam ham /
translated: “Oṃ, Vajra Padmasattva, I am!

original: aom a'a:h'um sv'a h'a /🔽gsum mo // aom badzro pa met tha ke h'um sv'a h'a /🔽gsum mo / aom badzra yakshe h'um /
analyzed: aom a'a:h'um sv'a h'a / gsum mo // aom badzro pa met tha ke h'um sv'a h'a / gsum mo / aom badzra yakshe h'um /
translated: “Oṃ āḥ hūṃ svāhā.🔽“Oṃ, Vajra Utpala Thake, hūṃ svāhā.

original: gsum mo // aom badzra pushpe h'um /🔽aom badzra dh'u pe h'um /
analyzed: gsum mo // aom badzra pushpe h'um / aom badzra dh'u pe h'um /
translated: “Oṃ, Vajra Yakṣe, hūṃ.🔽“Oṃ, Vajra Puṣpe, hūṃ.🔽“Oṃ, Vajra Dhūpe, hūṃ.

original: badzra d'i pe h'um /🔽badzra gandhe h'um /
analyzed: badzra d'i pe h'um / badzra gandhe h'um /
translated: “Oṃ, Vajra Dīpe, hūṃ.🔽“Oṃ, Vajra Gandhe, hūṃ.

original: badzra nee bi dye h'um /
analyzed: badzra nee bi dye h'um /
translated: “Oṃ, Vajra Naivedye, hūṃ.

original: tishtha badzra h'um /🔽badzra bh'u me h'um /
analyzed: tishtha badzra h'um / badzra bh'u me h'um /
translated: “Oṃ, Tiṣṭha Vajra, hūṃ.🔽“Oṃ, Vajra Bhūmi, hūṃ.

original: badzra yakshe h'um /
analyzed: badzra yakshe h'um /
translated: “Oṃ, Vajra Yakṣe, hūṃ.

original: ba su dha re sv'a h'a /
analyzed: ba su dha re sv'a h'a /
translated: “Oṃ, Vasudhare, svāhā.

original: de nas rang gi snying gar gnas pa'i tslum gi yi ge'i 'od zer steng phyogs yang dag par bkad nas 'og min gyi srid par gnas pa'i thog ma med pa nas grub pa'i bcom ldan 'das ma nor rgyun ma spyan drang bar bya ste /
analyzed: de nas rang gi snying gar gnas pa'i tslum gi yi ge'i 'od zer steng phyogs yang dag par bkad nas 'og min gyi srid par gnas pa'i thog ma med pa nas grub pa'i bcom ldan 'das ma nor rgyun ma spyan drang bar bya ste /
translated: Then, having emitted light rays from the syllable c(l)um located in one's heart to the upper direction, one should invite Bhagavatī Vasudhārā, who has existed from beginningless time in the Akaniṣṭha realm.🔽Oṁ, Śrīka(r)i Dhānyaka(r)i, come, come!

original: aom shr'i ka ri dh'a n+ya ka ri a'a gatstsha a'a gatstsha br'i sv'a h'a /🔽gsum mo // au ke bhu ke warsha ni pra warsha ni /🔽nishpa da ni ba su dha r'a bh'att'a ra k'a ye p'a dyam pra t'itstsha sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom shr'i ka ri dh'a n+ya ka ri a'a gatstsha a'a gatstsha br'i sv'a h'a / gsum mo // au ke bhu ke warsha ni pra warsha ni / nishpa da ni ba su dha r'a bh'att'a ra k'a ye p'a dyam pra t'itstsha sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṁ, u(k)e bhu(k)e, rain, rain!

original: proksha nam pra t'i tstsha sv'a h'a /
analyzed: proksha nam pra t'i tstsha sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṁ, niṣpā(d)a ni, bestow the gift of water, the essence of the earth, the essence of the sky, I pay homage!🔽Oṁ, prokṣaṇa, I pay homage!

original: aanytsa @333a * //🔽m'a nam pra t'itstsha sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aanytsa @333a * // m'a nam pra t'itstsha sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṁ, a(n)ca(n)a, I pay homage!🔽Oṁ, mā(n)a(n)a, I pay homage!

original: aargham pra t'itstsha sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aargham pra t'itstsha sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṁ, argha, I pay homage!

original: dza:h'um bam ho:/ rang rang gi gdan la bzhugs par bsams nas me tog bkod par bya'o //🔽aom a'a:h'um sv'a h'a /
analyzed: dza:h'um bam ho:/ rang rang gi gdan la bzhugs par bsams nas me tog bkod par bya'o // aom a'a:h'um sv'a h'a /
translated: Jaḥ hūṁ vaṁ hoḥ. Having imagined them seated on their respective seats, one should arrange the flowers.🔽Oṁ āḥ hūṁ svāhā.

original: aom shr'i ba su dha re sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom shr'i ba su dha re sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṁ, Śrī Vasudhārā, svāhā!

original: aom ba su dha re ba su bishti p'a ta ya ba su dha re sv'a h'a /🔽dzlum tslum ba su dha re sv'a h'a /🔽lakshi bh'u ta la ni b'a sa n'i ye sv'a h'a /🔽badzra dha ra s'a ga ra ni gho sha t'a ya sv'a h'a /🔽a'ary'a pa lo ki te shva r'a ya sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom ba su dha re ba su bishti p'a ta ya ba su dha re sv'a h'a / dzlum tslum ba su dha re sv'a h'a / lakshi bh'u ta la ni b'a sa n'i ye sv'a h'a / badzra dha ra s'a ga ra ni gho sha t'a ya sv'a h'a / a'ary'a pa lo ki te shva r'a ya sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ vasudhārā vasuvisthipātāya vasudhārā svāhā.🔽Jlum clum vasudhārā svāhā.🔽Lakṣmībhūtalaninīyai svāhā.🔽Vajradharasāgarani ghoṣāya svāhā.🔽Āryāvalokiteśvarāya svāhā.🔽

original: badzra p'a ni yaksha se n'a dhi pa ta ye sv'a h'a /🔽ai la de w'i ye sv'a h'a /🔽dzam bha la dza lendr'a ya sv'a h'a /🔽pi tsi kunda l'i ne sv'a h'a /🔽ki li m'a l'i ne sv'a h'a /🔽mu khendr'a ya sv'a h'a //🔽tsa rendr'a ya sv'a h'a /🔽gubta de w'i ye sv'a h'a /🔽su gupta de w'i ye sv'a h'a /🔽sha ra svast'i de w'i ye sv'a h'a /🔽tsandra kant'a de w'i ye sv'a h'a /🔽ma ni bha dr'a ya sv'a h'a /🔽p'urna bha dr'a ya sv'a h'a /🔽dha na d'a ya sv'a h'a /🔽bee shra ba n'a ya sv'a h'a /
analyzed: badzra p'a ni yaksha se n'a dhi pa ta ye sv'a h'a /🔽ai la de w'i ye sv'a h'a /🔽dzam bha la dza lendr'a ya sv'a h'a /🔽pi tsi kunda l'i ne sv'a h'a /🔽ki li m'a l'i ne sv'a h'a /🔽mu khendr'a ya sv'a h'a //🔽tsa rendr'a ya sv'a h'a /🔽gubta de w'i ye sv'a h'a /🔽su gupta de w'i ye sv'a h'a /🔽sha ra svast'i de w'i ye sv'a h'a /🔽tsandra kant'a de w'i ye sv'a h'a /🔽ma ni bha dr'a ya sv'a h'a /🔽p'urna bha dr'a ya sv'a h'a /🔽dha na d'a ya sv'a h'a /🔽bee shra ba n'a ya sv'a h'a /
translated: Vajrapāṇi Yakṣa Senādhipati Svāhā.🔽Īḍadeva’s Svāhā.🔽Jambhala Jālandhara’s Svāhā.🔽Piṭakunda-līna’s Svāhā.🔽Kilāmālīna’s Svāhā.🔽Mukhendra’s Svāhā.🔽Carendrā’s Svāhā.🔽Kuberadeva’s Svāhā.🔽Suguptadeva’s Svāhā.🔽Śarasvatīdeva’s Svāhā.🔽Candrakāntadeva’s Svāhā.🔽Manibhadra’s Svāhā.🔽Pūrṇabhadra’s Svāhā.🔽Dhāna’s Svāhā.🔽Vaiśravaṇa’s Svāhā.🔽

original: ba ru na n'a ga r'a dz'a ye sv'a h'a /🔽aindr'a ya sv'a h'a /🔽ya m'a ya sv'a h'a /🔽ba ru n'a ya sv'a h'a /🔽ku be r'a ye sva h'a /🔽aagna ye sv'a h'a /🔽nee rri tye sv'a h'a /
analyzed: ba ru na n'a ga r'a dz'a ye sv'a h'a / aindr'a ya sv'a h'a / ya m'a ya sv'a h'a / ba ru n'a ya sv'a h'a / ku be r'a ye sva h'a / aagna ye sv'a h'a / nee rri tye sv'a h'a /
translated: To Varuna, king of the nagas, svāhā.🔽To Indra, svāhā.🔽To Yama, svāhā.🔽To Varuna, svāhā.🔽To Kubera, svāhā.🔽To Agni, svāhā.🔽To Nairṛti, svāhā.🔽

original: b'a ya be sv'a h'a /🔽a'i sha n'a dhi pa ta ye sv'a h'a /🔽ae te sh'am ma ma sarba satv'a n'am sarba s'a dha n'am hi ra nya su barnna ni dha n'a n'am de hi mam da d'a ba ye sv'a h'a /🔽ba sudha r'i ye sv'a h'a /🔽pushpa ba sundha r'i ye sv'a h'a /🔽dh'u pa ba su dha r'i ye sv'a h'a /🔽d'i pa ba su ma ti pri y'a ye sv'a h'a /🔽gandha ba su dh'a ra dh'a ra n'i ye sv'a h'a /🔽nee bi dye badzra pushpe sv'a h'a /🔽badzra b'a ye sv'a h'a /🔽badzra darsha na pha l'a ya sv'a h'a /🔽badzra tam bu yee sv'a h'a /🔽aom a'a:h'um sv'a h'a /🔽badzra satva sam gra ha /
analyzed: b'a ya be sv'a h'a /🔽a'i sha n'a dhi pa ta ye sv'a h'a /🔽ae te sh'am ma ma sarba satv'a n'am sarba s'a dha n'am hi ra nya su barnna ni dha n'a n'am de hi mam da d'a ba ye sv'a h'a /🔽ba sudha r'i ye sv'a h'a /🔽pushpa ba sundha r'i ye sv'a h'a /🔽dh'u pa ba su dha r'i ye sv'a h'a /🔽d'i pa ba su ma ti pri y'a ye sv'a h'a /🔽gandha ba su dh'a ra dh'a ra n'i ye sv'a h'a /🔽nee bi dye badzra pushpe sv'a h'a /🔽badzra b'a ye sv'a h'a /🔽badzra darsha na pha l'a ya sv'a h'a /🔽badzra tam bu yee sv'a h'a /🔽aom a'a:h'um sv'a h'a /🔽badzra satva sam gra ha /
translated: Vaya ve svāhā.🔽Aiśānādhipataye svāhā.🔽Eteṣāṃ mamānu sarvasattvānāṃ ca sarvasādhanahīranyasubarnanidhānaṃ dehi mamāvadāya svāhā.🔽Vasudharīye svāhā.🔽Puṣpavasundharīye svāhā.🔽Dhūpavasundharīye svāhā.🔽Dīpavasumatīpriyāye svāhā.🔽Gandhavamaṇḍalaratnaye svāhā.🔽Nevidye vajrapuṣpe svāhā.🔽Vajravāye svāhā.🔽Vajradarśana phalāya svāhā.🔽Vajratambuye svāhā.🔽Oṃ āḥ hūṃ svāhā.🔽Vajrasatva saṃgraha.🔽

original: badzra ratna ma nutta ra /
analyzed: badzra ratna ma nutta ra /
translated: Vajra ratna ma nuttara

original: badzra karma ka rotbha ba /🔽badzra dharma g'a ya sv'a h'a /
analyzed: badzra karma ka rotbha ba / badzra dharma g'a ya sv'a h'a /
translated: Vajra karma karothabha🔽Vajra dharma gāya svāhā

original: badzra l'a sye h'um /
analyzed: badzra l'a sye h'um /
translated: Vajra lāsyai hūṃ

original: badzra m'a le tr'am /
analyzed: badzra m'a le tr'am /
translated: Vajra māle trām🔽Vajra gīti hrīḥ🔽Vajra nṛtye āḥ🔽Vajra puṣpe hūṃ

original: badzra g'i ti hr'i:badzra nri tye aa:badzra pushpe h'um /🔽badzra dh'u pe tr'am /🔽badzra a'a lo ke hr'i:/
analyzed: badzra g'i ti hr'i:badzra nri tye aa:badzra pushpe h'um / badzra dh'u pe tr'am / badzra a'a lo ke hr'i:/
translated: Vajra dhūpe trām🔽Vajra āloke hrīḥ🔽Vajra gandhe āḥ

original: badzra gandhe a'a:/ na ma ste h'um /🔽na ma:mi h'um /
analyzed: badzra gandhe a'a:/ na ma ste h'um / na ma:mi h'um /
translated: Namaḥ sthe hūṃ🔽Namaḥ mi hūṃ

original: na mo na ma h'um sv'a h'a /
analyzed: na mo na ma h'um sv'a h'a /
translated: Namo namaḥ svāhā

original: rtog par gsungs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstod de /
analyzed: rtog par gsungs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstod de /
translated: With the praise beginning “Spoken in the tantras…”🔽All the nonvirtue I have done without control,

original: dbang med bdag gis mi dge bgyis pa dang // yang na bgyid stsal rjes su yi rang gang //🔽de dag thams cad byang chub mchog gi ni //
analyzed: dbang med bdag gis mi dge bgyis pa dang // yang na bgyid stsal rjes su yi rang gang // de dag thams cad byang chub mchog gi ni //
translated: Or caused others to do, or rejoiced in,🔽I confess each and every one

original: spyan sngar da lta so sor bshags par bgyi //
analyzed: spyan sngar da lta so sor bshags par bgyi //
translated: In the presence of the supreme enlightenment.🔽The two accumulations of the Sugata’s heirs,

original: bde gshegs sras @333b kyi tshogs gnyis zab pa dang // rgya chen 'gro ba ma lus pa yi don //🔽sgrub par byed dang de las gzhan pa la //
analyzed: bde gshegs sras @333b kyi tshogs gnyis zab pa dang // rgya chen 'gro ba ma lus pa yi don // sgrub par byed dang de las gzhan pa la //
translated: The profound and vast, for the sake of all beings without exception,🔽I always rejoice in

original: rtag tu bdag ni rjes su yi rang ngo //
analyzed: rtag tu bdag ni rjes su yi rang ngo //
translated: The practice of that and in what is other than that.

original: byams pa dang snying rje dang dga' ba dang btang snyoms te byams pa ni bu gcig pa ltar mnyes gshin pa'i rnam pa can gyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: byams pa dang snying rje dang dga' ba dang btang snyoms te byams pa ni bu gcig pa ltar mnyes gshin pa'i rnam pa can gyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: Love, compassion, joy, and equanimity. Love has the characteristic of the attitude of fondness, like that for an only child.

original: snying rje ni sdug bsngal lam sdug bsngal gyi rgyu las yang dag par 'don par 'dod pa nyid do //
analyzed: snying rje ni sdug bsngal lam sdug bsngal gyi rgyu las yang dag par 'don par 'dod pa nyid do //
translated: Compassion is the desire to deliver from suffering or the cause of suffering.

original: dga' ba ni sna tshogs rnams kyi dge ba dang de rnams kyi longs spyod dang dbang phyug rnams la sems mgu ba nyid do //
analyzed: dga' ba ni sna tshogs rnams kyi dge ba dang de rnams kyi longs spyod dang dbang phyug rnams la sems mgu ba nyid do //
translated: Joy is the delight in the virtue of the various beings and in their enjoyment and mastery.

original: btang snyoms ni rnyed pa dang ma rnyed pa dang grags pa dang ma grags pa dang / bstod pa dang smad pa dang bde ba dang sdug bsngal zhes pa 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad la sogs pa las phyir phyogs pa nyid do //🔽aom sva bh'a wa shuddh'a:sarba dharm'a:sva bh'a ba shud dho& ham /
analyzed: btang snyoms ni rnyed pa dang ma rnyed pa dang grags pa dang ma grags pa dang / bstod pa dang smad pa dang bde ba dang sdug bsngal zhes pa 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad la sogs pa las phyir phyogs pa nyid do // aom sva bh'a wa shuddh'a:sarba dharm'a:sva bh'a ba shud dho& ham /
translated: Equanimity is the attitude of turning away from the eight worldly dharmas, such as gain and loss, fame and disgrace, praise and blame, pleasure and pain.🔽Om svabhāva śuddhāḥ sarvadharmāḥ svabhāva śuddho ’ham.

original: aom sh'u n+ya t'a dzny'a na badzra sva bh'a wa a'atma ko& ham /
analyzed: aom sh'u n+ya t'a dzny'a na badzra sva bh'a wa a'atma ko& ham /
translated: Om śūnyatājñāna vajra svabhāva ātmako ’ham.

original: de nas sngon gyi smon lam gyi nus pas yam gis rlung gi dkyil 'khor kha dog sngon po gzhu dang 'dra ba g-yo ba'i ba dan gyis mtshan par byas pa yam yig byin gyis brlab pa'o //
analyzed: de nas sngon gyi smon lam gyi nus pas yam gis rlung gi dkyil 'khor kha dog sngon po gzhu dang 'dra ba g-yo ba'i ba dan gyis mtshan par byas pa yam yig byin gyis brlab pa'o //
translated: Then, by the power of former prayers, the wind mandala is blessed by the syllable yam, which is blue in color, shaped like a bow, and marked with a fluttering banner.

original: de'i steng du ram yig gis me'i dkyil 'khor zur gsum pa 'bar bas mtshan par byas pa ram yig gis byin gyis brlab pa'o //
analyzed: de'i steng du ram yig gis me'i dkyil 'khor zur gsum pa 'bar bas mtshan par byas pa ram yig gis byin gyis brlab pa'o //
translated: Upon that, the fire mandala is blessed by the syllable ram, which is triangular, marked with flames, and marked with the syllable ram.

original: bam yig gis chu'i dkyil 'khor zlum po kha dog dkar po bum pas mtshan pas bam yig gis byin gyis brlab pa'o //
analyzed: bam yig gis chu'i dkyil 'khor zlum po kha dog dkar po bum pas mtshan pas bam yig gis byin gyis brlab pa'o //
translated: The water mandala is blessed by the syllable vam, which is round, white in color, marked with a vase, and marked with the syllable vam.

original: lam yig gis sa'i dkyil 'khor gru bzhi pa kha dog ser po rdo rjes mtshan pa lam yig gis byin gyis brlab pa'o //
analyzed: lam yig gis sa'i dkyil 'khor gru bzhi pa kha dog ser po rdo rjes mtshan pa lam yig gis byin gyis brlab pa'o //
translated: The earth mandala is blessed by the syllable lam, which is square, yellow in color, marked with a vajra, and marked with the syllable lam.

original: sum yig gis ri rab gru bzhi pa rin po che bzhi'i rang bzhin rtse mo brgyad kyis nye bar mdzes pa'o //
analyzed: sum yig gis ri rab gru bzhi pa rin po che bzhi'i rang bzhin rtse mo brgyad kyis nye bar mdzes pa'o //
translated: The Meru mountain is blessed by the syllable sum, which is square, made of the four precious substances, and beautified with eight peaks.

original: h'um yig gis sna tshogs rdo rje'i lte pa la gnas pa'i h'um yig gis khang pa brtsegs pa bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: h'um yig gis sna tshogs rdo rje'i lte pa la gnas pa'i h'um yig gis khang pa brtsegs pa bsgom par bya ste /
translated: One should visualize the palace of the syllable HŪM located at the center of the variegated vajra by means of the syllable HŪM.

original: gru bzhi pa sgo bzhi pa rta babs bzhis mdzes pa dra ba dang dra ba phyed pas spras pa /
analyzed: gru bzhi pa sgo bzhi pa rta babs bzhis mdzes pa dra ba dang dra ba phyed pas spras pa /
translated: It is square, with four doors, beautified by four porticos, and adorned with nets and half-nets.

original: nor bu dang rdo rje phyed pa dang zla tshes dang / rdo rje rin po che rnams kyis sgo dang sgo khyud kyi mtshams rnams su spras pa /
analyzed: nor bu dang rdo rje phyed pa dang zla tshes dang / rdo rje rin po che rnams kyis sgo dang sgo khyud kyi mtshams rnams su spras pa /
translated: It is adorned at the corners of the doors and door-frames with jewels, half-vajras, crescents, and vajra-gems.🔽It has vases, pillars, great vajras, and

original: bum pa dang ka ba dang rdo rje chen po dang / phyogs can gyi @334a * //
analyzed: bum pa dang ka ba dang rdo rje chen po dang / phyogs can gyi @334a * //
translated: portions of

original: mda' yab can /
analyzed: mda' yab can /
translated: wind-chariots.

original: dril bu dang ba dan gyis mdzes pa /
analyzed: dril bu dang ba dan gyis mdzes pa /
translated: It is beautified with bells and banners,

original: rnga yab la sogs pas rnam par brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: rnga yab la sogs pas rnam par brgyan pa'o //
translated: and is adorned with yak-tail fans and so forth.

original: de'i nang du pam yig 'dab ma sna tshogs pa'i padma 'dab ma brgyad dang / ze'u 'bru dang ge sar dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de'i nang du pam yig 'dab ma sna tshogs pa'i padma 'dab ma brgyad dang / ze'u 'bru dang ge sar dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Inside of that, an eight-petaled lotus arises from the syllable PAṂ, with filaments and pistils.

original: de'i steng du aa yig gis zla ba'i dkyil 'khor te /
analyzed: de'i steng du aa yig gis zla ba'i dkyil 'khor te /
translated: Upon that, a moon maṇḍala arises from the syllable A.

original: de'i dbus su tslum gi yi ges bum pa bzang po'o //
analyzed: de'i dbus su tslum gi yi ges bum pa bzang po'o //
translated: In the center of that, a good vase arises from the syllable ṢṬRĪ.

original: bum pa bzang po yongs su gyur pas bcom ldan 'das ma nor rgyun ma sku mdog ser mo zhal gcig ma /
analyzed: bum pa bzang po yongs su gyur pas bcom ldan 'das ma nor rgyun ma sku mdog ser mo zhal gcig ma /
translated: The excellent vase completely transforms into Bhagavatī Vasudhārā, who is yellow, has one face,

original: phyag drug ma /
analyzed: phyag drug ma /
translated: and six arms.

original: rin po che'i cod pan can ;
analyzed: rin po che'i cod pan can ;
translated: She wears a jeweled crown.

original: rol stabs kyis bzhugs pa /
analyzed: rol stabs kyis bzhugs pa /
translated: She stands in the dancing posture.

original: g-yas pa'i phyag dang po gter ston pa /
analyzed: g-yas pa'i phyag dang po gter ston pa /
translated: Her first right hand holds a treasure.

original: phyag gnyis pas rin po che'i char 'bebs pa /
analyzed: phyag gnyis pas rin po che'i char 'bebs pa /
translated: Her second hand holds a rain of jewels.

original: phyag gsum pas de bzhin gshegs pa rdo rje 'chang rgya mtsho'i dbyangs la phyag mdzad pa /
analyzed: phyag gsum pas de bzhin gshegs pa rdo rje 'chang rgya mtsho'i dbyangs la phyag mdzad pa /
translated: Her third hand makes homage to the tathāgata Vajradhara Sāgara­ghoṣa.

original: g-yon pa'i phyag dang pos bum pa bzang po /
analyzed: g-yon pa'i phyag dang pos bum pa bzang po /
translated: Her first left hand holds an excellent vase.

original: phyag gnyis pas 'bras kyi snye ma /
analyzed: phyag gnyis pas 'bras kyi snye ma /
translated: Her second hand holds a sheaf of rice.

original: phyag gsum pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i glegs bam 'dzin pa /
analyzed: phyag gsum pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i glegs bam 'dzin pa /
translated: Her third hand holds a volume of the Perfection of Wisdom.

original: rin po che'i rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: rin po che'i rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /
translated: She is adorned with all jeweled ornaments.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rdo rje 'chang rgya mtsho'i dbyangs ni sku mdog ser po chos gos gyi grva 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rdo rje 'chang rgya mtsho'i dbyangs ni sku mdog ser po chos gos gyi grva 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The tathāgata Vajradhara Sāgara­ghoṣa is yellow and holds the corner of his Dharma robe.

original: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug ni sku mdog dmar po phyag na rnga yab can no //
analyzed: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug ni sku mdog dmar po phyag na rnga yab can no //
translated: Noble Avalokiteśvara is red in color and holds a yak-tail whisk.

original: gnod sbyin gyi sde'i bdag po phyag na rdo rje sku mdog ljang gu phyag na rnga yab can no //
analyzed: gnod sbyin gyi sde'i bdag po phyag na rdo rje sku mdog ljang gu phyag na rnga yab can no //
translated: Yakṣa-senāpati Vajrapāṇi is green in color and holds a yak-tail whisk.

original: lha mo ai dra li mdog ser mo rin po che'i snye ma 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: lha mo ai dra li mdog ser mo rin po che'i snye ma 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Goddess Iḍalī is yellow in color and holds a jeweled flower cluster.

original: chu'i dbang po dzam bha la sku mdog sngon po ne'u le dang / shing thog p'i dza p'u ra ka 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: chu'i dbang po dzam bha la sku mdog sngon po ne'u le dang / shing thog p'i dza p'u ra ka 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Water-lord Jambhala is blue in color and holds a mongoose and a jābu fruit.

original: tsi pi kunda li mdog dmar po lag na me tog can no //
analyzed: tsi pi kunda li mdog dmar po lag na me tog can no //
translated: Cipika is red in color and holds a flower.

original: ke li m'a li mdog dmar po lag na bdug spos can no //
analyzed: ke li m'a li mdog dmar po lag na bdug spos can no //
translated: Kelimālikā is red in color and holds incense.

original: sgo'i dbang po mdog ser po lag na mar me can no //
analyzed: sgo'i dbang po mdog ser po lag na mar me can no //
translated: Door-lord is yellow in color and holds a lamp.

original: spyod pa'i dbang po mdog dmar po lag na dri chab can no //
analyzed: spyod pa'i dbang po mdog dmar po lag na dri chab can no //
translated: Conduct-lord is red in color and holds perfume.

original: sbas ma mdog sngo bsangs lag na rnga yab can no //
analyzed: sbas ma mdog sngo bsangs lag na rnga yab can no //
translated: Hidden is blue in color and holds a yak-tail whisk.

original: legs sbas ma mdog dmar mo lag na gdugs can no //
analyzed: legs sbas ma mdog dmar mo lag na gdugs can no //
translated: Well-hidden is red in color and holds a parasol.

original: dbyangs @334b can ma mdog ser mo lag na rgyal mtshan can no //
analyzed: dbyangs @334b can ma mdog ser mo lag na rgyal mtshan can no //
translated: Sarasvatī is yellow and holds a banner.

original: zla tshes ma mdog dkar mo lag na ba dan can no //🔽nor bu bzang po mdog dkar po ne'u le dang shing thog gi b'i dza p'u ra ka 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: zla tshes ma mdog dkar mo lag na ba dan can no // nor bu bzang po mdog dkar po ne'u le dang shing thog gi b'i dza p'u ra ka 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Candra is white and holds a flag.🔽Bhadrapadma is white and holds a mongoose and a myrobalan fruit.

original: gang ba bzang po mdog sngon po rin po che'i snye ma dang / b'i dza p'u ra ka 'dzin pa'o //🔽nor sbyin mdog dmar mo bum pa bzang po dang b'i dza p'u ra ka 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: gang ba bzang po mdog sngon po rin po che'i snye ma dang / b'i dza p'u ra ka 'dzin pa'o // nor sbyin mdog dmar mo bum pa bzang po dang b'i dza p'u ra ka 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Pūrṇabhadra is blue and holds a jewel and a myrobalan fruit.🔽Vasudattā is red and holds an excellent vase and a myrobalan fruit.

original: rnam thos sras mdog ser po rin po che'i myu gu dang b'i dza p'u ra ka 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam thos sras mdog ser po rin po che'i myu gu dang b'i dza p'u ra ka 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Vaiśravaṇa is yellow and holds a jewel sprout and a myrobalan fruit.

original: klu'i rgyal po chu lha mdog dkar po sbrul zhags 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: klu'i rgyal po chu lha mdog dkar po sbrul zhags 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The nāga king Varuṇa is white and holds a snake noose.

original: aom a'a: h'um rang gi snying gar gnas pa'i tslum gi yi ge'i 'od zer gyis steng yang dag par bkang nas 'og min gyi srid pa na bzhugs pa'i ye shes sems dpa' spyan drang bar bya zhing /
analyzed: aom a'a: h'um rang gi snying gar gnas pa'i tslum gi yi ge'i 'od zer gyis steng yang dag par bkang nas 'og min gyi srid pa na bzhugs pa'i ye shes sems dpa' spyan drang bar bya zhing /
translated: “Oṃ āḥ hūṃ. Light rays from the syllable cliṃ in my heart fill the space above, inviting the gnosis beings who reside in Akaniṣṭha.

original: sa ma ya sa mya sa ma yam ka ri ma h'a sa ma ye sv'a h'a /
analyzed: sa ma ya sa mya sa ma yam ka ri ma h'a sa ma ye sv'a h'a /
translated: Samaya samya samayamakarimāhasamaye svāhā.

original: lan gsum / zhabs bsil la sogs pas mchod cing /
analyzed: lan gsum / zhabs bsil la sogs pas mchod cing /
translated: Having made offerings with the foot-washing water and so forth,

original: dza:h'um bam ho:/ dam tshig sems dpa' dang ye shes sems dpa' dag ro gcig tu gyur par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: dza:h'um bam ho:/ dam tshig sems dpa' dang ye shes sems dpa' dag ro gcig tu gyur par bsam par bya'o //
translated: Jḥḥḥḥ vaṃ hoḥ. Think that the pledge beings and awareness beings become of one taste.

original: aom aa bhi shinytsa nu m'am sarba ta th'a ga ta /
analyzed: aom aa bhi shinytsa nu m'am sarba ta th'a ga ta /
translated: Oṃ abhiṣiñcanu māṃ sarvatathāgata.

original: dbang bskur rdo rje chen po ni //
analyzed: dbang bskur rdo rje chen po ni //
translated: The great vajra empowerment

original: khams gsum pa yis phyag byas pa ;🔽/ sangs rgyas kun gyi gsang gsum gyi //
analyzed: khams gsum pa yis phyag byas pa ; / sangs rgyas kun gyi gsang gsum gyi //
translated: is honored by the three realms.🔽It arises from the place of the three secrets

original: gnas las byung ba sbyin par bya //
analyzed: gnas las byung ba sbyin par bya //
translated: of all buddhas and is granted.

original: 'di de sangs rgyas thams cad nyid //
analyzed: 'di de sangs rgyas thams cad nyid //
translated: This is the very one of all buddhas,

original: mchod pa'i 'dren pa'i cod pan te //
analyzed: mchod pa'i 'dren pa'i cod pan te //
translated: the diadem that leads the offering.

original: rigs lnga las ni byung ba'o //
analyzed: rigs lnga las ni byung ba'o //
translated: It arises from the five families.

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi cod pan che //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi cod pan che //
translated: It is the great diadem of all buddhas.

original: mah'a mu ku ta pra t'i tstsha sv'a h'a //
analyzed: mah'a mu ku ta pra t'i tstsha sv'a h'a //
translated: Mahāmudrā pratīccha svāhā.

original: ji ltar bltams pa tsam gyis ni //
analyzed: ji ltar bltams pa tsam gyis ni //
translated: Just as at the time of birth

original: lha rnams kyis ni khrus gsol ltar //
analyzed: lha rnams kyis ni khrus gsol ltar //
translated: the gods bathed the Buddha,🔽in the same way I bathe you

original: lha yi chu ni dag pa yi //🔽de bzhin bdag gis khrus bgyi'o //
analyzed: lha yi chu ni dag pa yi //🔽de bzhin bdag gis khrus bgyi'o //
translated: with pure divine water.

original: aom a'a:aa bhi she ka sa ma ya shri ye h'um sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom a'a:aa bhi she ka sa ma ya shri ye h'um sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ āḥ abhiṣeka samaya śrīye hūṃ svāhā.

original: slar yang zhabs bsil la sogs pas mchod do //
analyzed: slar yang zhabs bsil la sogs pas mchod do //
translated: Again, one should worship with the foot-washing and so forth.

original: slar yang me tog dgod cing sgeg mo brgyad kyis so //
analyzed: slar yang me tog dgod cing sgeg mo brgyad kyis so //
translated: Again, with the placement of flowers and the eight lovely maidens.

original: bcom ldan 'das mnor rgyun ma ye shes kyi sku can la bdag phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mnor rgyun ma ye shes kyi sku can la bdag phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: I pay homage to the Blessed Lady, the stream of the mind, the body of wisdom.

original: nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'i yon tan yid kyi shing rta gsang ba mo sngags sgrogs pa dang ldan pa la'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'i yon tan yid kyi shing rta gsang ba mo sngags sgrogs pa dang ldan pa la'o //
translated: I pay homage to the one who is equal to space, the chariot of the mind, the secret one, the one who proclaims the mantra.
Here,

original: yon tan gyi gter dang gser rin po che'i char pa dang skye bo mang po'i nor 'phel ba dang rgya mtsho'i rin po che'i phung po dkyil 'khor dang bcas pa rang gi lus la rab tu gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: yon tan gyi gter dang gser rin po che'i char pa dang skye bo mang po'i nor 'phel ba dang rgya mtsho'i rin po che'i phung po dkyil 'khor dang bcas pa rang gi lus la rab tu gzhug par bya'o //
translated: one should cause the treasure of her qualities, the rain of gold and jewels, the increase of wealth of many beings, and the mass of jewels of the ocean together with the maṇḍala to enter one's own body.

original: aom dzlum tslum sv'a h'a /🔽sna la nor bu bzang po'o //
analyzed: aom dzlum tslum sv'a h'a / sna la nor bu bzang po'o //
translated: Oṃ jlum clum svāhā.🔽On the nose, Subhadra.

original: dpral ba la gang ba bzang po'o //
analyzed: dpral ba la gang ba bzang po'o //
translated: On the forehead, Pūrṇabhadra.

original: kha la nor sbyin no //
analyzed: kha la nor sbyin no //
translated: In the mouth, Vasudatta.

original: brla zung dag la rnam thos sras so //
analyzed: brla zung dag la rnam thos sras so //
translated: On the two thighs, Vaiśravaṇa.

original: rkang pa gnyis la tsi pi kunda li'o //
analyzed: rkang pa gnyis la tsi pi kunda li'o //
translated: At the two feet, Cīpikuṇḍalī.

original: gsang ba la ke li m'a li ni'o //
analyzed: gsang ba la ke li m'a li ni'o //
translated: At the secret place, Kelimālinī.

original: snying gar zhal gyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: snying gar zhal gyi dbang po'o //
translated: At the heart, Vakṣasthala.

original: yan lag thams cad la spyod pa'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: yan lag thams cad la spyod pa'i dbang po'o //
translated: At all the limbs, Caritrapati.

original: zhabs bsil la sogs pas mchod pa dang / me tog dgod pa dang sgeg mo brgyad do //
analyzed: zhabs bsil la sogs pas mchod pa dang / me tog dgod pa dang sgeg mo brgyad do //
translated: The eight, beginning with the foot-washing, are the eight types of offering.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab rdzas ni 'phel ched dang // rin chen du ma gser ni 'phel ched du //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab rdzas ni 'phel ched dang // rin chen du ma gser ni 'phel ched du //
translated: For the sake of increasing inconceivable substances, and for the sake of increasing gold and many jewels,

original: khang pa 'dir ni dkyil 'khor yongs rdzogs la //
analyzed: khang pa 'dir ni dkyil 'khor yongs rdzogs la //
translated: in this house, in the complete maṇḍala,

original: dpal ldan nor rgyun ma la rtag phyag 'tshal //
analyzed: dpal ldan nor rgyun ma la rtag phyag 'tshal //
translated: I always pay homage to glorious Vasudharā.

original: bzlas pa dang gtor ma'o //
analyzed: bzlas pa dang gtor ma'o //
translated: Recitation and bali offering.

original: aom ba su dha re sarba bha ya ha re bighn'an sh'anti ka re pra kri ti pra bh'a sv'a re ai mam ba lim grihna grihna /
analyzed: aom ba su dha re sarba bha ya ha re bighn'an sh'anti ka re pra kri ti pra bh'a sv'a re ai mam ba lim grihna grihna /
translated: Oṃ vasudhare sarvabhāya hare vighaṇa śāntika re prakṛti prabhāsvara īma baliṃ gṛhaṇa gṛhaṇa.

original: aom aa k'a ro mu kham sarba dharm'a n'am a'adya nutpanma tv'at aom a'a:h'um /
analyzed: aom aa k'a ro mu kham sarba dharm'a n'am a'adya nutpanma tv'at aom a'a:h'um /
translated: Oṃ akāro mukhaṃ sarvadharmāṇāṃ adhyātmaṃ nutpādamudīraya āḥ hūṃ.

original: aanytsa ma nam pra t'itstsha sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aanytsa ma nam pra t'itstsha sv'a h'a /
translated: Añcamanaṃ pratīccha svāhā.

original: me tog la sogs pa mchod par bya'o//
analyzed: me tog la sogs pa mchod par bya'o//
translated: Offer flowers and so forth.
